function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Use of PCR technologies and endogenous biomarker measurements may lead to inaccurate identification of specific diseases.","Impact":"Misidentification of diseases could lead to ineffective containment measures and contribute to the spread of contagious diseases.","Mitigation":"Combine PCR technologies and endogenous biomarker measurements with other more specific diagnostic methods to confirm disease identification.","Technologies":"Use of specific antigen tests and viral culturing techniques for confirmation of disease identification.","People":"Public health officials, epidemiologists, and healthcare workers","Owner":"Healthcare organizations, public health agencies"},{"Description":"Inaccurate identification of specific diseases due to biomarkers not being specific to a given disease, leading to misdiagnosis and ineffective containment measures.","Impact":"Misdiagnosis can lead to the spread of contagious diseases and ineffective treatment of patients.","Mitigation":"Use a combination of biomarkers specific to the disease and confirmatory diagnostic tests to improve accuracy of disease detection.","Technologies":"Specific antigen tests, viral culturing techniques, and advanced diagnostic imaging methods.","People":"Healthcare workers, laboratory technicians, and medical researchers","Owner":"Healthcare organizations, medical research institutions"},{"Description":"Detection of asymptomatic cases and immunized patients through WBE may lead to complacency and reduced adherence to preventive measures.","Impact":"Reduced adherence to preventive measures could contribute to the spread of contagious diseases and hinder efforts to control outbreaks.","Mitigation":"Educate the public on the continued importance of preventive measures regardless of immunity status and asymptomatic cases.","Technologies":"Communication technologies for public health education and awareness campaigns.","People":"Public health officials, community leaders, and healthcare workers","Owner":"Public health agencies, government health departments"}]}
